Algerian military plane with more than 100 soldiers crashes, several dead: Reports

The plane was carrying more than 100 military personnel, according to local media.

world Updated: Apr 11, 2018 14:51 IST
Agencies, Algiers (Algeria)
A screengrab from the video posted on local channel Ennahar TV. The Ennahar TV reported that more than 100 military personnel were on board the plane when it came down near Boufarik airport. (Ennahar TV Online)

An Algerian military plane crashed on Wednesday near Boufarik airport near the capital Algiers, killing several people, local media and a witness said.

More than 100 military personnel were on board the plane when it came down near Boufarik airport, local channel Ennahar TV reported. There was no immediate confirmation from authorities.

Television footage showed black smoke billowing near a motorway and a crowd of security officials and others standing in a field next to the crash site.

The tail fin of a plane could be seen above olive trees, with smoke and flames rising from the wreckage.

The Algerie Presse service agency said the Iliouchine-type plane was headed for Bechar in south-western Algeria.

Boufarik is located in northern Algeria, near the Mediterranean sea, some 30 kilometres from the capital, Algiers.
